frontMatter.title: Manage benefits and tools
frontMatter.description: Follow this pattern to help users manage their benefits and tools through a structured list interface.
frontMatter.intro: Use this pattern to help users manage their benefits and tools through a structured service list interface.

when_to_use.value: **Benefits enrollment.** Displaying benefits or tools users are currently enrolled in.
**Tool access.** Showing tools users have access to.
**Service list implementation.** When implementing the Service List Item component.

design_principles.value: **Scannable.** Limited amount of information per list object.
**Consistent hierarchy.** Consistent content and hierarchy across all list items.
**Uniform functionality.** Uniform supporting functionality for sorting/filtering.

when_not_to_use.value: **Non-benefit items.** Don't use for non-benefit/non-tool items.
**Interactive forms.** When showing benefits within interactive forms with checkboxes.
**Unordered lists.** For unordered list content, use the List component instead.
**Search results.** For global search results, use the Search Results Template.

examples.title: Benefits list
examples.description: Disability compensation, education, housing, life insurance, pension, VRE displayed as service list items.

examples.title: Tools list
examples.description: Appointments, claims, prescriptions, secure messages, medical records displayed as service list items.

how_to_build.intro: Stack Service List Items vertically with critical actions at the top.

steps.value: Items with Critical Action components appear at the top.
Display order follows content needs (alphabetical, date-based, etc.).

accessibility.value: Headings and links must be descriptive and unique.
Support screen reader navigation through stacked items.
Ensure status indicators don't rely solely on color.
